title: Hello ! I'm Diego,
a Fullstack Developer
Hero.typewriter: Developing is my passion, and I love turning ideas into experiences worth sharing.

Bio.heading: Lifting, Learning, Coding: A Journey of Passion
description: I've always been driven by a deep curiosity and a desire to explore different worlds. Sports are an essential part of my balance: whether it's on a football field, in the gym, or during an intense training session, I find discipline, resilience, and energy that motivate me every day.

Video games also play an important role in my life. Beyond entertainment, they have taught me patience, logic, and the ability to stay focused on a goal while enjoying the process of learning and improving.

Programming naturally became part of this journey. I see it as the same dynamic: taking on challenges, building step by step, finding solutions, and seeing the concrete results of my work. Every line of code feels like a piece of a bigger picture that gradually takes shape.
I chose this profession because development allows me to combine my passion for creating with my desire to make things simpler, more efficient, and more meaningful for others.
Today, I put my expertise into projects that matter, with the ambition to keep learning, growing, and sharing what I love to do.

Projects.title: Learning, Creating, Delivering: My Work in Action

ProjectsData.title: Frimity
ProjectsData.description: Mobile app dedicated to discovering and organizing leisure activities, streamlining event planning and enriching the user experience.
ProjectsData.stack: React Native, Express.js, MongoDB, Docker, Git
ProjectsData.context: As the mobile full-stack lead at Frimity, I've owned the end-to-end rollout of new features to connect users with local events. I designed and implemented an event geolocation module, built a ticketing and registration system, developed a personalized activity feed, and created an organizer dashboard with real-time analytics. I structured our REST API in Express.js, modeled cross-platform data schemas in MongoDB, and automated our Docker-based CI/CD pipeline in GitLab for builds, tests, and deployments.
challenges: Achieving smooth, high-performance rendering of long lists and interactive maps in React Native while loading geospatial data and images on the fly.
Implementing a robust offline-first strategy with local caching and conflict-resolution sync to allow users to browse and register for events without a network.
Managing separate App Store and Play Store certificate workflows, enforcing strict semantic versioning, and enabling rapid rollback on critical bug fixes.
Coordinating feature releases with our UI/UX team and integrating Jest & Detox end-to-end tests to catch regressions before they reach production.

ProjectsData.title: TrainBuddy
ProjectsData.description: Web and mobile platform supporting strength-training athletes with personalized workout tracking and intuitive session management.
ProjectsData.stack: Next.js, Java, Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, Git
ProjectsData.context: Driven by my passion for both sports and software development, I conceived TrainBuddy as a way to sharpen my technical skills while creating a tool to motivate strength athletes to train consistently. I envisioned a platform combining a clean, engaging UX with powerful performance tracking, leveraging the full spectrum of Next.js from static site generation and server-side rendering to seamless client-side hydration. Working solo, I managed everything from initial UX ideation through to production deployment, ensuring each feature encouraged regular engagement and smooth progression.
challenges: Mastering Next.js end-to-end: implementing Server-Side Rendering (SSR), Static Site Generation (SSG), and client-side transitions, while optimizing load times and SEO performance.
Owning the project entirely as a solo developer: defining the roadmap, handling both back-end (Java/Spring Boot) and front-end (Next.js) development, and maintaining the production environment.
Designing a compelling UI/UX with limited design background: choosing components, establishing clear visual hierarchy, and crafting intuitive user flows to ensure rapid onboarding.
Ensuring user retention through an intuitive experience: integrating relevant notifications, real-time performance feedback, and light gamification to keep users coming back.

Optimizing data architecture for scalability: structuring PostgreSQL schemas, implementing caching strategies, and scheduling batch jobs for statistical calculations without compromising responsiveness.

ProjectsData.title: Sopra Steria
ProjectsData.description: Internal web application for managing project proposals, orders, and billing cycles for the CNAM within Sopra Steria's Santé Social Emploi vertical.
ProjectsData.context: During my second-year apprenticeship at Sopra Steria Group, I joined the Santé Social Emploi (SSE) vertical's team to enhance and maintain a critical internal tool for the CNAM. As a Solution Builder, I contributed to all phases of the project lifecycle analysis, development, testing, and deployment working within a V-model process, collaborating via Git and HP ALM, and delivering features and fixes through on-premise and cloud environments.
challenges: Onboarding to a large-scale enterprise V-model workflow, including HP ALM test management and strict bi-monthly release cycles.
Developing new web features in AngularJS and Java backend services while adhering to detailed functional specifications and legacy data models.
Automating and optimizing SQL Server and VBA-based Excel integrations for high-volume data imports despite limited initial familiarity with VBA.
Implementing performance tuning and query optimization to resolve production scalability issues and reduce application latency.
Coordinating multi-stage deployments creating Git tags, generating WAR artifacts, and executing scripted deployments in QUALIF and PROD while ensuring data integrity and minimal downtime.

ProjectsData.title: Shift89
ProjectsData.description: Marketing website and client portal for 4innovation, designed to showcase services and enable client interactions.
ProjectsData.stack: Angular, Azure Logic Apps, SQL Azure, GitHub, VS Code
ProjectsData.context: During my apprenticeship at Shift89, I joined a small distributed development team to build and refine 4innovation's web presence and client portal. I was responsible for turning Adobe XD mockups into Angular modules, configuring Azure Logic Apps for backend workflows, and managing SQL Azure databases. Working primarily remotely, we held daily stand-ups and weekly client meetings to iteratively deliver features.
challenges: Acquiring hands-on proficiency in Angular and TypeScript to create responsive SPA modules based on designer mockups.
Owning end-to-end development as a solo alternant: environment setup, code collaboration on GitHub, and continuous learning under remote conditions.
Designing and implementing UI/UX flows without formal design training, ensuring rapid user onboarding through intuitive interfaces.
Orchestrating Azure Logic Apps and functions to realize codeless backend integrations, handling HTTP triggers and SQL actions seamlessly.
Structuring SQL Azure schemas and maintaining separate development and production databases to support safe testing and deployment.
